verb.description: Abandon (a person, cause, or organization) in a way considered disloyal or treacherous.
examples: we feel our public representatives have deserted us

noun.description: A dry, barren area of land, especially one covered with sand, that is characteristically desolate, waterless, and without vegetation.

origin: Middle English: via Old French from late Latin desertum something left waste, neuter past participle of deserere leave, forsake.
